definitions: Put (money) into financial schemes, shares, property, or a commercial venture with the expectation of achieving a profit.
Devote (one's time, effort, or energy) to a particular undertaking with the expectation of a worthwhile result.
Provide someone or something with (a particular quality or attribute).
Formally confer (a rank, office, or authority) on someone.
Clothe (someone) in the vestments of office or dignity.
examples: She invested her savings in stocks.
He invested a lot of time in his studies.
The artist invested the painting with a sense of mystery.
The queen invested him with the title of knight.
The bishop was invested in his new robes.
